title: Juventus fan thrown out of hospital for not being sick

locations.name: ospedale san giovanni di dio hosptial

text:
A healthy Juventus fan was thrown out of a hospital in Crotone for trying to gain admittance so he could watch his team beat Crotone.
Demand was so high for Crotone's first match against the Turin giants in the Italian Serie A that the ticket office sold out.
However, one undeterred fan thought he could get into Ospedale San Giovanni di Dio Hosptial, where some windows happen to overlook the Enzo Scido pitch.
Fans went to extreme methods to catch a glimpse of their heroes, such as Gonzalo Higuain (L)
Gonzalo Higuain, Paulo Dybala and others were on display for all to see from the hospital
Actual patients watch on from the hospital as Crotone play Juventus under the floodlights
Crotone fans get an aerial view of their team against AS Bari during the 2013 Serie B playoff
The hospital was well prepared though, having dealt with similar attempts from desperate fans back in 2006, when Juventus were in Serie B.
5 things you didn't know about Crotone It has a population of 62,178 (Jan 2016)
It's the second most southern team in the Serie A behind Sicillian Palermo
This is the club's first season in Serie A
Their nickname is the Squali (Sharks)
Crotone has never scored vs Juve
Supporters claimed to be relatives of patients in order to watch the game for free from the hospital windows.
According to Reggio Informa , the hospital announced that theyâ€™d be running a 'patient only' admittance policy on match-day, with no visits allowed in the run up to kick-off.
The local Juve fan was 'dismissed as healthy' and turned away.
Crotone, second from bottom, held the visitors out for an hour before Mario Mandzukic broke the deadlock.
Gonzalo Higuain doubled the lead 14 minutes later to seal the 2-0 victory and put Juventus seven points clear at the top of Serie A, on course for their sixth title in a row.
